astronomers.name: Galileo Galilei
astronomers.contribution: Early telescopic observations (e.g., Jupiter’s moons; phases of Venus) that shaped observational astronomy.

astronomers.name: Giovanni Domenico Cassini
astronomers.contribution: Observations of Saturn and discoveries of major Saturnian moons; influential in early modern astronomy.

astronomers.name: Giuseppe Piazzi
astronomers.contribution: Discovery of Ceres (1801), the first identified asteroid (now classified as a dwarf planet).

astronomers.name: Angelo Secchi
astronomers.contribution: Pioneer of astronomical spectroscopy and early stellar classification.

history.summary: Systematic telescopic observation became a central method of astronomy, accelerating evidence-based cosmology and planetary studies.
Spectroscopy and systematic classification emerged as core tools for studying stellar physics and composition.
Italy’s astronomy ecosystem is coordinated through national research infrastructures and observatories supporting astrophysics and space science.
